content:
Saturday, September 2 Evening Update

Incident: Sartin Draw Fire Wildfire
Released: 20 min. ago

Saturday, September 2, 2017 Evening Update

Firefighters in conjunction with local ranchers put in another hard day of work and are making great progress in putting this fire to bed. In preparation for the forecasted weather fire resources conducted two large burn operations today to reduce the amount of unburned vegetation inside the fire perimeter. This reduces the likelihood that unburned vegetation in the fire area will ignite and cast embers over the fireline when high winds arrive. The fire has containment lines (dozer constructed, black line and/or road systems) along the edge of the fire and is not spreading.

At 12:00 PM today the County Assist Team also assumed management of the Snider Fire burning in Rosebud County. Thursday morning the two fires burned together along a small section of the Tongue River Road. Aviation resources flew the fires today and determined the fire is 6,393 acres in size. More information on this fire will be available tomorrow in our morning update.

Tomorrows planned actions include: patrol the western side of the fire along the Tongue River Road and Beaver Creek Road; improve line and mop-up containment lines on the southern edge of the fire; and hold and improve line and mop-up 3 chain (200 feet) in on the eastern side of the fire. Fire resources on the northern side will hold and improve line along Foster Creek Road and burn out pockets of unburned vegetation that are well in the interior of the containment line.

RESOURCES:

21 Engines

3 Crews

14 Heavy Equipment (7 dozers, 3 skidgens, 4 water tender)

212 Total Personnel
